intro: Dianthus serenaeus, commonly known as the Serene Pink, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and alpine settings. The flowers are often used in ornamental horticulture due to their vibrant color and compact growth habit.
